snippet: With many of the world’s economies performing poorly, stock investors can no longer count on markets abroad for bigger gains. Some funds have managed at least to minimize their losses.
abstract: Paul J Lim Fundamentally column observes that with many of the world’s economies performing poorly, stock investors can no longer count on markets abroad for bigger gains; points out some international mutual funds have managed at least to minimize their losses; notes that according to Morningstar, the average foreign fund fell 6.1 percent in the second quarter, and the average European fund fell 8.4 percent.
lead_paragraph: With many of the world’s economies performing poorly, stock investors can no longer count on markets abroad for bigger gains. Some funds have managed at least to minimize their losses.

headline.seo: For Mutual Funds, Safe Harbors Are Harder to Find
headline.main: In a Tough World, Fewer Places to Hide
headline.print_headline: In a Tough World, Fewer Places to Hide
